subject: Programming
title: Weighted Graphs and Shortest Paths
description: A quick win: understand Weighted Graphs and Shortest Paths.

hook.text: Not all roads are equal. Some are longer, more expensive, or slower. Weights capture these differences.

buildup.text: Weighted graphs assign a cost to each edge. Finding the cheapest path requires smarter algorithms.

discovery.text: Dijkstra's algorithm greedily picks the cheapest next step, guaranteeing the optimal total path.

twist.text: Dijkstra fails with negative weights. Bellman-Ford handles them but runs slower.

climax.text: Every GPS, flight booking, and network router uses weighted shortest path algorithms daily.

punchline.text: The cheapest path isn't always the shortest one.

quiz.question: Why can't Dijkstra's algorithm handle negative weights?
options: Its greedy approach assumes costs only increase
It requires all edges to be equal
